attributes.action: I wish the Home Office to review the case of a Fijian soldier Semesa Maiyale.
attributes.background: Semesa Maiyale known as Sam joined the British army in 2003 and served with the Kings Own Scottish Borders and then the Royal Regiment of Scotand serving nine years,completed tours of Iraq and was promised the right to remain in the Uk after his service ended.
attributes.additional_details: Sam was discharged in 2012, Sam has no right to work, cannot claim benefits or housing and is supported by his partner who as a staff nurse is having to provide for the both of them and their son. sam rightly feels betrayed and let down.

attributes.action: Revise section 59 and withdraw the photographer / Car Spotter 48 hour ban/fine
attributes.background: Section 59 is being abused by officers, it is used to threaten high powered supercar owners. The Police Reform Act needs to be revised and officers reminded on how to use there authority. Also car spotters should not face any ban or fine due to the actions of drivers and should be left alone.
attributes.additional_details:
There have been 2 cases of police issuing bans to car spotters and i feel that it is assured, anyone has the right to take a picture. Even so there may be tourists who have flown in and may simply want to take a picture of a luxurious sports car to then face a ban in a well known tourist attraction with a fine. Also in the papers wealthy luxurious have been finding there stay here very troubling and unwelcoming as the police have been stopping them purely for the fact that they can.  

NOCKAM

attributes.action: Make NHS gender service waiting times easier for transgender people
attributes.background: I am asking to ease the long waiting times for gender services in the UK, by allowing trans people to begin reversible treatment before they are seen by a specialist. This would prevent them from struggling with crippling gender dysphoria while they are on the waiting list, which can be over a year.
attributes.additional_details:
Lots of trans patients suffer with gender dysphoria, which in turn causes depression and suicidal feelings. Not being able to begin treatment can have a severe impact on mental health.
Many trans people take hormone blockers. This is a drug which is completely safe, 100% reversible and prevents trans people from going through changes which don't match their gender identity. All I ask is that the use of hormone blockers in the waiting period is considered, so their general wellbeing is improved.

attributes.action: Issue every Police Constable in England & Wales with a TASER by 01/01/17.
attributes.background: Police resources are continually stretch and the number of front line uniformed Police Constables is reduced year on year, whilst the number of violent crimes and assaults on Police continues to rise.  TASER is a proven less than lethal option and should be issued to front line uniformed officers.

attributes.action: More funding and awareness of mental health issues in young adults
attributes.background: After many friends suffering from mental health issues, I felt that this was an important topic, as mental health is often seen as inferior to physical illnesses

attributes.action: Political neutrality rules should apply to both TV & newspapers during elections
attributes.background: Whilst recognising the need for a pluralistic press the referendum campaign demonstrated media barons attempt to influence voting. We believe this to be wrong and that newspapers should adopt a neutral, balanced and fair position during campaigns as TV news is required to do

attributes.action: Don't cancel the British EU Referendum
attributes.background: In response to the petition "Cancel the planned referendum on Britain's continued membership of the EU" which is fundamentally an affront to the ability of the people to exercise their democratic will. Leave or Remain please show your support for a democratic process that enfranchises the people

attributes.action: Stop The Council Penalty Charges for Driving in Bus Lanes on Bank Holidays!
attributes.background:
I was given 3 separate tickets for driving in a bus lane on a Bank Holiday by Harrow Council, each a few seconds apart.

I do not drive on bus lanes but after my investigation, I realised it was on a bank holiday and I must have assumed because it was bank holiday the same rules on Sunday applies.
attributes.additional_details:
Stop The Council from issuing Penalty Charges for Driving in Bus Lanes on Bank Holidays!

There are many motorists with the same stories. 

http://www.govyou.co.uk/remove-the-ambiguity-re-bank-holiday-use-of-bus-lanes/

http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/news/local-news/warning-reveal-number-drivers-fined-8789712

attributes.action: Call for a Public Enquiry into TTIP, CETA & all future Free Trade Agreements.
attributes.background:
The EU and Canada have concluded secret negotiations in the proposed trade agreement CETA, which is now in the process of ratification.

Most commentators believe this constitutes the beginning of the 'race to the bottom' in standards and regulations for food, the environment and public services.
attributes.additional_details:
Included within CETA are the controversial investor-state dispute settlement (ISDS) mechanism and Regulatory Cooperation, which brings international trade harmonisation and greater corporate profits at the expense of public safety. It is said that CETA leaves the back door open for TTIP.

We ask this Enquiry to investigate CETA & TTIP, recommend safeguards for the publics interest in all future UK trade agreements and for legislation to outlaw the practice of secret free trade negotiations.

attributes.action: Fund more beds in Northampton General to help reduce cancelled operations
attributes.background:
Northampton Hospital's Chief Executive Sonia Swart said 60 to 120 new beds are required to cope with daily pressures. She said: "Additional bed capacity would ensure patients operations weren't cancelled at the last minute." 
These beds are needed to ensure people get the right care.
attributes.additional_details: More beds at Northampton Hospital would 'save money' - http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-northamptonshire-35937990

attributes.action: Create new Animal and Domestic Pet Protection legislation to imprison abusers
attributes.background: Britian is a nation of animal lovers, with an estimated 46% of households having a domestic pet. Unfortunately however, animal cruelty offences continue to occur, with very little in the way of "animal rights" to prevent them, or to punish offenders. Pets mean more than the "property" defined in law
attributes.additional_details:
Recently introduced legislation in the US will allow courts to treat those who abuse animals in the same vein as humans. Numerous physiological research conclude that one of the first steps towards a person being mentally capable of taking another human life often start off abusing and killing animals

At the moment pet homocide can only be treated as 'criminal damage', but with people like the Croydon cat killer freely walking the streets we believe stronger legislation should be introduced.

attributes.action: We are calling on the Govt to strip Thameslink Govia of their rail franchise.
attributes.background: Govia Thameslink has the highest number of passenger journeys but the lowest customer satisfaction rates and the lowest PPM of any UK rail network. There has been a continuous decline in their PPM measure since 2015. They have the second highest rate of cancellation & significantly late running.
attributes.additional_details:
Thameslink Govia's poor management is evident in:
The lack of adequate contingency plans to cope with disruption.
Poor & inaccurate information provided to customers 
The ongoing staffing disputes without major disruption to the network. 
Continually increasing fares with declining service levels

We urge the government to urgently review the situation and award the franchise to a company which can deliver a consistent, good level of service.

attributes.action: Make Organ Donation compulsory in the U.K. unless an individual opts out.
attributes.background:
As of 2010, 24 European countries have some form of presumed consent (opt-out) system, with the most prominent and limited opt-out systems in Spain, Austria, and Belgium yielding high donor rates.

In the United Kingdom organ donation is voluntary and no consent is presumed.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently there are over 7,000 people on the UK national transplant waiting list and, during the last financial year, over 1,300 people either died whilst on the waiting list or became too sick to receive a transplant. This is because, despite more than 500,000 people dying each year in the UK, fewer than 5,000 people die in circumstances where they can become a donor. 

If we can increase the amount of people by only 5% this will save lives each and every week in the UK.

attributes.action: Make Boris Johnson apologise to the People of Egypt for his untrue comments.
attributes.background:
We, the British people that are living in or visiting Egypt on a regular basis request that Boris Johnson apologise for saying that there is a burgeoning crisis in Egypt, when it is not true. 
We are living and visiting the country happily and safely, please come and visit us and see for yourself.
attributes.additional_details: There are numerous British expats here in Egypt that can confirm that his comments are not true.

attributes.action: Cuts to Local Authority Housing Budgets must be stopped, reviewed and increased.
attributes.background: More and more people are living in poor quality social housing. I visited a family recently who were given a 3 bedroom flat to live in temporarily until a permanent home was found for them. I have photos of the appalling condition of this property in Rochdale. This is happening across the UK.
attributes.additional_details: The property let to the family I visited was filthy, I have photos to prove this, there was no wallpaper on the hall and stairs leading up to the flat. Instead it had graffiti on the walls, plaster that looked liked it had been put on with someones fingers, holes in the walls, mould on the floors and walls, dirt inside kitchen cupboards. Surely properties should be in a better state than this? More money needs to be given for local authorities to give homes to people in a fit state.

attributes.action: Link Local Housing Allowance rates to actual private rent prices.
attributes.background: People on lower incomes that have to rent suitable housing privately are finding substantial shortfalls between rents and LHA, even with the cheapest of houses. Council tenants in the same circumstances have all their rent paid. This is not fair.
attributes.additional_details: e.g.: A family of 4 in 3 bed ex Council terraced house, Chalvedon Estate, Pitsea, Basildon. An area classified as being an area of multiple deprivations by the ONS. Average rent £1000 pcm. LHA: £815 pcm. This means a shortfall of £285 pcm. A family of 4 in exactly the same house owned by the Council... no shortfall!

attributes.action: Reject any statutory instrument preventing McKenzie Friends charging a fee
attributes.background: In February 2016, the UK Judiciary quietly published a Consultation paper on reforming their approach to McKenzie Friends (MFs) who are (non-Solicitor/Barrister helpers). The Judiciary proposes preventing MFs from charging fees, regulating them, yet no have the right to 'represent' you for Court.
attributes.additional_details: The Presidents Guidance on McKenzie Friends 2010 gives the judges discretion to permit your MF to act for you and manage your case.  It is very rare to get permission. The Employment Tribunals Act 1998 s6 provides that a person may appear in person or else be represented at an employment tribunal by: (a) counsel/ solicitor, (b) a rep of a trade union or an employers’ association, or (c) any other person in whom the party desires to represent him. The same rights should apply in family courts.

attributes.action: Ban disposable plastic crockery and cutlery to help the environment
attributes.background: Recently France became the first country to pass an all-out ban on plastic cutlery, plates, and cups. Let's follow their example through a ban on disposable plastic tableware. These plastics affect our environment and use fossil fuels. Plastic pollution is a pervasive issue but we can change this.
attributes.additional_details:
Plastics are extremely durable, lightweight, cheap and versatile - features which mean that they have replaced many traditional materials such as metal, glass and wood. Unfortunately these features make them the most pervasive, persistent and hazardous form of litter in our environment. 

Furthermore, plastic manufacturing is estimated to use 8 percent of yearly global oil production. This precious resource is being wasted on disposable products for 'convenience'. This is not sustainable.

attributes.action: We demand an immediate increase in Government aid for the famine in Yemen
attributes.background: Children are starving to death in Yemen. Millions of people are malnourished & this is quickly becoming one of the most catastrophic famines of the 21st Century. A million & a half children are currently starving to death in a famine partly caused by damage inflicted by UK-provided weaponry.
attributes.additional_details:
Human Right's Watch Report detailing use of UK-made weaponry: https://www.hrw.org/news/2016/07/11/saudi-coalition-airstrikes-target-civilian-factories-yemen

7 Million people near starvation - Huffington Post: http://www.huffingtonpost.com/william-lambers/yemen-the-forgotten-famin_b_10864754.html

The role of the West in Yemen's war - The Economist: http://www.economist.com/news/middle-east-africa/21702651-lucrative-devastating-war-role-west-saudi-arabiau2019s-war

attributes.action: Say No to an "Independence Day" Bank Holiday on 23rd June.
attributes.background:
Nigel Farage has called for the 23rd of June to be celebrated as the UK's "Independence Day", and that the date should be a Bank Holiday.

We the undersigned feel that Mr. Farage should not be rewarded in this fashion for his actions in the EU Referendum.
attributes.additional_details:
A Bank Holiday bearing Mr. Farage's name would be giving too much publicity to a man who has misled the electorate on multiple occasions, and who behaved despicably with regard to the "Breaking Point" poster.

This Bank Holiday would also be offensive to the 16.1m voters who voted to remain a part of the European Union, and who would not want be reminded of this fact every year.

attributes.action: Take fluffy bedding for hamsters off the shelves! It's dangerous!
attributes.background: In January 2016, I bought my first hamster & I now have 6! During this short time of owning hamsters I have observed posts on hamster forums  regarding the dangers of fluffy bedding. This bedding can cause serious injury & even fatality to a hamster as a direct consequence of using it.
attributes.additional_details:
Respiratory issues - If this bedding enters the hamsters lungs it can cause infection. In many cases this isn't curable & will lead to death. 

Blockages - If the hamster was to consume the bedding, and it is very possible, it can not be digested. This will lead to blockages within the hamsters system that can not be dislodge.

Limbs - The most common cause of injury regarding fluffy bedding is limb trapping. The bedding can trap the limbs within its fine strands resulting in amputation.

attributes.action: Fully regulate Student Loans Company, with reform of the repayment process.
attributes.background: Many graduates have been left thousands of pounds short by an administrative process that is not fit for purpose. This petition calls on the Government to reform the repayment process and regulate Student Loans Company in line with retail lenders.
attributes.additional_details:
Graduates leave education with thousands of pounds worth of debt that is repaid via their payslips. The money is collected by HMRC and passed to Student Loans Company annually to be credited to the outstanding balance.

Current arrangements mean that money is frequently not credited to the loan, despite being paid by the graduate. This means it can take longer to repay a student loan, while interest is accrued.

HMRC and SLC do not to have mechanisms to check/rectify mistakes in a timely manner.

attributes.action: Call for an independent review into political bias within the BBC.
attributes.background: During recent weeks the BBC has been showing bias towards the Conservative party. On numerous occasions the BBC has failed to report fairly on industrial action in the public sector. The latest example is the non reporting of the Conservative party breaking rules on election funding

attributes.action: Take policy action to bring down and stabilise house prices
attributes.background: Since 2000, UK house prices have increased by over 140%, far outstripping wages and inflation. The average new home-owner is now 35. We call on the government to adopt the following policies designed to bring down housing market prices and stabilise them at an affordable level.
attributes.additional_details:
Previous governments have used policies designed to encourage rising prices to benefit existing owners, seriously hurting younger people.

This can be stopped and reversed by new policies such as:
-Restrictions on large scale and foreign investor landlords
-Protect remaining council houses and housing associations
-End low rates for buy-to-let
-Progressively tax multiple properties.

We call on the government to consider any and all of these options.

Homes are more important than investments.

attributes.action: Make it law for the tethering of horses to be a criminal offence.
attributes.background: A tethered horse is a horse on a length of chain. Unable to move beyond the confines of the chain and often without shelter, sufficient grazing and water. Many are tethered 24/7 and spend their days going round and round in circles. They are not living, just existing. You can help end this.
attributes.additional_details: If you would like to see instances of tethered horses and how  despondent and resigned to their fate they look then visit the Facebook page of  Save the Papermill Horses.

attributes.action: Reduce waiting times for domestic abuse and sexual assault counselling services.
attributes.background: The waiting list for counselling services following sexual assault or abuse is usually around 4 months for an assessment alone. Rape Crisis centres are experiencing more and more requests for support. Nearly a million people are raped every year, but in the last few years have had their funding cut.
attributes.additional_details:
Sexual assault and abuse are often seen as taboo and not spoken about. Many survivors suffer in silence, unable to get the help they need to recover. These types of crimes have the lowest conviction rates making survivors unable to speak up.

In my own and friends' experiences, people with PTSD are often turned away from most mental health services, including the NHS. Most of the UK do not have access to a Rape Crisis centre. This needs to change.

http://rapecrisis.org.uk/statistics.php

attributes.action: The UK must ban the foreign financing of all new MOSQUES
attributes.background: As we go forward in the Uk,it has become apparent that the Uk like other European countries has a problem with the financing of mosques.We call on the government to ban all foreign finance from building or the planning of any new mosques

attributes.action: A referendum on an elected House of Lords and a proportional representation.
attributes.background: In the recent referendum on membership of the EU, one of the key arguments revolved around democracy and the role of unelected officials in law making processes. The U.K. has 800 unelected officials in the legislative process, and a voting system that does not accurately represent citizen's views.

attributes.action: Allow commuters to claim income tax relief on the cost of travelling to work.
attributes.background: Commuters spend their own money to travel to work. Fuel & public transport costs rise and it costs more per year to get to work. House prices force people out of areas & make more expensive commutes. Where workers live & where companies are located could be positively influenced by such a move.
attributes.additional_details:
If all workers had the opportunity to claim tax relief on their annual commute this would ease the housing market, create job mobility and employment in more regions. 
An annual railcard from Worcester to Paddington costs £10,000. If a 40% tax payer could claim income tax back against this, it would have an effective cost of about £6500. It is unfair, unreasonable & damaging to the mindset of all employees that they are taxed to go to work.It is an unfair burden on hard working people.

attributes.action: We call upon the Secretary of State for Health to define "A Seven Day NHS"
attributes.background: In addition,to state whether it is Minister's intentions to increase the work force by the 20-40% necessary to achieve a "A Seven Day NHS",the size of increase depending on the definition offered. Or to simply shift staff from one time frame to another, thereby degrading the whole service?
attributes.additional_details:
For many months now, various senior government members have trotted out the phrase "A Seven Day NHS" without defining their intentions. Do they mean emergency cover at all times? Do they mean enhancing the current emergency cover by increasing diagnostic and other services out of hours? Or do they mean elective services seven days a week?
Each model implies a very different requirement for staffing, and associated funding. 
We call upon the Minister to set out this Governments plans in detail.

attributes.action: Create a system for doctors to refer patients with two or more cancer symptom.
attributes.background: Mum presented many cancer symptoms over two years each treated individually, and the lump diagnosed as a cyst. She actually had advanced ovarian cancer. If she had been tested on symptoms being first presented she would have had a better chance of survival.
attributes.additional_details:
Professor Graham Neale found 15% misdiagnosed as minor ailments.
Early diagnosis of ovarian cancer has a survival rate of 90% rather than 5% for advanced stages of the disease and 70% compared to 14% in lung cancer. 
Diagnostic routes range between 12 and 38% of cancer cases diagnosed by Doctor referrals between 3% and 58% are diagnosed through hospital admissions. The majority presented at hospital and were far more advanced. One year survival rates were lower for those presenting at hospital.

attributes.action: The derogatory term 'Kufar' used to describe 'Non Muslims' should be banned.
attributes.background: We are constantly reminded of what is 'Politically correct' when discussing anything to do with Islam. We find the word used against us by some members of the Islamic faith totally unacceptable and offensive. Other faiths should  be regarded with the same respect that the followers of Islam expect.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3751080/The-face-hatred-unveiled-Wife-jailed-Choudary-clearly-identified-time-vows-non-Muslims-Britain-destroyed.html
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6DsG9yQrdD4

http://www.urbandictionary.com/define.php?term=Kuffar

The people are tired of the British Government having a 'Two tier' system. We should all be respected equally. We have a right to be treated equally . Allowing this derogatory term to be used in public should be treated as a hate crime.

attributes.action: MPs to debate ending Southern (Govia) rail franchise amid ongoing failures.
attributes.background: Southern has proved incapable of running a rail service, shifting blame on to the unions, Network Rail and even passengers for expecting to be able to get to and from work on time! Cutting nearly 350 daily services hasn't helped; MPs must act to take the franchise away and give metro routes to TfL.
attributes.additional_details:
www.standard.co.uk/news/transport/southern-rail-should-be-placed-under-immediate-control-of-tfl-sadiq-khan-says-a3299956.html

www.standard.co.uk/news/transport/southern-rail-commuters-fury-as-birkbeck-station-is-left-without-any-trains-to-central-london-a3294956.html

www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2016/jul/15/rail-minister-claire-perry-resigns

www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/southern-rail-timetable-trains-services-times-cancellations-disrupted-strikes-cuts-a7130401.html

attributes.action: Stop the use of the Professional Skills tests (Qualified Teacher Status QTS)
attributes.background: My daughter has ADHD. She's been offered a degree with QTS but failed the tests twice. The format causes sensory issues for her. Why is she not competent when she passed her GCSEs with an AB&C in 2014? Why are we allowing discriminating tests to lose passionate teachers of our future generations?
attributes.additional_details:
All prospective trainee teachers must pass the skills tests before they can be recommended for the award of qualified teacher status (QTS). It consists of two exams, some questions are written and presented in a series of on-screen questions, others are audio with headphones. 
Surely we should be ensuring we train the right people and not place a barrier in their way that appears to be meaningless and provides no evidence to support it has any impact on the selection process?

attributes.action: Create a new bank holiday on 16 June 2016
attributes.background: We want Thursday 16th June to be a new bank holiday to allow people to watch the Euro 2016 England vs Wales and Ukraine vs Northern Ireland football games. This is the first time Wales and Northern Ireland have competed in the Euros and we do not want employees to be deprived of this privilege.
attributes.additional_details: We think this would be a positive movement in order to encourage the friendly and competitive nature of football. The European Championships only occur once every four years and employees will be denied of this privilege due to working circumstances. The England vs Wales game includes two of the UKs countries competing at 2.30pm, meaning employees will not be able to watch this. Additionally, the Northern Ireland vs Ukraine game is on at 5.00pm which further restricts employees.

attributes.action: Parliament to debate whether cows must be able to graze outside freely.
attributes.background: Countryfile recently showed dairy cows living their whole lives in sheds, 24/7 52 weeks a year. They never feel a breeze or sun on their backs. Fed processed meals they never chew fresh grass. Cruelty to cows is bad for our diets too. We want fair prices for our farmers and freedom for cows. Grass.
attributes.additional_details:
Daily Express on Countryfile programme. 
http://www.express.co.uk/showbiz/tv-radio/657888/Countryfile-viewers-slam-intensive-dairy-farming-Matt-Bake-Ellie-Harrison-Charlotte-Smith

World Animal Protection - Full Fact Milk Pledge
http://www.worldanimalprotection.org.uk/campaigns/factory-farming/take-action-dairy-cows?utm_medium=TWI&utm_source=farming&utm_campaign=#Fullfactmilk&utm_content=PE

attributes.action: Scrap HS2. Spend the money on existing infrastructure, trains and rolling stock
attributes.background: HS2 benefits very few people. It is already £200m over budget. The Sheffield connection is cancelled and route has changed. The money is better spent on improving existing routes and reinstating some of the old routes to increase access to a greater proportion of the population.

attributes.action: Abolish the banned dog breed list
attributes.background: The banned dog breed list is inhumane against the dogs on it. The police can seize a dog if they think it is a Pitbull. So any cross Staffie could be classed as a pitbull in the police's eyes. No dog is aggressive unless the owner makes them. The owners are to blame not the dog.
attributes.additional_details:
Banned dogs
In the UK, it’s against the law to own certain types of dog. These are the:

Pit Bull Terrier
Japanese Tosa
Dogo Argentino
Fila Braziliero

If your dog matches many of the characteristics of a Pit Bull Terrier, it may be a banned type.
A police or council dog expert will judge what type of dog you have and it will be kept in kennels while the police (or council) apply to a court
You’re not allowed to visit your dog while you wait for the court decision.

attributes.action: Introduce 'Gender Neutral' public toilets across the UK.
attributes.background:
The UK should scrap gender segregated public toilets by replacing them as gender neutral. 
Allowing people of any gender or gender identity to use the facility without the feeling of any fear, harassment, judgement, discrimination or abuse.
attributes.additional_details:
As part of the LGBT community myself, I find going to a gendered public toilet a scary experience and I'm sure I'm not alone.

I have experienced harassment in both male and female toilets and find its becoming more frequent. I believe myself and others should be able to do their business in peace without being questioned.
I feel 'neutralising' the gendered signage of all public toilets would provide a more comfortable and safer environment.

attributes.action: Increase penalty for animal cruelty
attributes.background: Anyone found guilty of causing injury/harm/suffering/neglect towards an animal should face a minimum prison sentence of 6 months and banned from owning any animal and a register made of all convicted persons

attributes.action: Regulate and license air rifles in the same way as other fire arms.
attributes.background: After being shot by an air rifle in a residential area, our family pet was paralysed when the pellet lodged in his spine he died of his injuries. My children play in the same garden this horrific act of cruelty took place we ask for tighter rules for fear of further tragedy to ours or other families
attributes.additional_details: Currently UK law states that no one under the age of 18 is allowed to buy, shoot or handle an air rifle and that they must be locked away in a robust cupboard and pellets ideally kept separately.  Clearly though this does not deter improper use of rifles and irresponsible users to shoot where serious, injury, maiming or even death can occur.

attributes.action: Reconsider increasing Asylum and immigration court fees
attributes.background: The government intends to increase the fees required to for asylum proceedings increasing the burden on some of the most vulnerable people in the world to meet a shortfall created by inadequately funding the justice system.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2016/apr/21/asylum-and-immigration-court-fees-set-to-rise-by-over-500

attributes.action: Patrons & trustees of charities are automatically disqualified from being an MP
attributes.background: Many MP's voted in favour of benefit cuts & are also associated with charities for those directly affected proving a LACK OF SUPPORT and a CONFLICT OF INTEREST. To avoid this MP's should resign their position within charities immediately & should NOT be allowed association with charities in any role

attributes.action: Lower Child Support where no Staying Contact, unless Child Protection issues.
attributes.background: Welfare Benefit Reforms mean the parent getting Child Benefit after separation can access the systems to get up to the income the law says they need.Child Support is not counted for means tested things, but more has to be paid if there is no Staying Contact, encouraging ex partners to try to stop it
attributes.additional_details: In the past 3 months there has been several cases on the Separated Dads Forum, where ex partners are opposing staying contact, just to get more Child Support. Some have even gone to the extent of false reports to Police/Social Services what then stopped contact for months, while investigation is ongoing. Children need both parents, and the no staying contact amount should only be paid in extreme cases due to Child Protection/Welfare. The starting amount should be based on 53-104 nights contact.

attributes.action: Abolish vat and council tax
attributes.background: Vat and council got introduced after we joined the European Union. No we are leaving it should be removed from citizens in the uk.

attributes.action: Ask the Government to set out clear proposals for leaving the EU
attributes.background:
We have voted to leave the EU,
BUT we have been given no clear idea of the Government's plans for
1. Our future trading relationships with the rest of the world;
2. Meeting the wishes of dissident parts of the UK.
These plans should be submitted for ratification by the public or Parliament.

attributes.action: Mock vote for 16-17 year olds, on EU referendum
attributes.background: Since the referendum has caused so much distress for many people, I believe there should be a mock vote  for the youth to prove what they want for their future. Young people have had no say in the referendum, and it's time they have their voice heard.

attributes.action: Fund adrenaline auto-injectors and training for life-threatening asthma attacks
attributes.background: Out of hospital asthma attacks kill 800 per year. News reports attest to the helplessness of parents and bystanders. At autopsy lungs are blocked with mucus plugs. Intramuscular adrenaline opens airways, reduces mucus, allows cough, and on arrival paramedics give it as part of severe asthma guidance
attributes.additional_details: President Obama's 2013 bill allowed adrenaline auto-injector use and training in schools for acute asthma and anaphylaxis with a Good Samaritan proviso. National Review of Asthma Deaths NRAD 2014 said "consider auto injectors if a patient had a previous life-threat attack or near fatal episode", which is no help in first time attacks. EpiPen, Jext, and Emerade needles pass through clothing injecting drug into thigh muscle; 2 or 3 injections may be needed. Ref. doi:10.1136/thoraxjnl-2015-207207

attributes.action: Create a cross Party committee to ensure a positive, inclusive exit from the EU
attributes.background: Many UK citizens fear that the EU exit will lead to a divided nation, governed by fear, hatred towards migrants, and a reduction in the investment in our public services. We need a moderate and progressive cross Party commitment to unity and hope. We want a urgent commitment to collaboration.
attributes.additional_details: With 48.1% of the UK population voting to remain in the EU this morning many of us have woken up to the shocking news that we are to leave the EU. We need to work together to ensure we build a positive outcome for everyone in the UK, and ensure that all Parties work collaboratively. The Government should urgently commit to a cross Party committee to oversee the implementation plan for the exit of the EU.

attributes.action: Make Voting transparent, publish who has voted , so to eliminate voting fraud
attributes.background:
Its not who voted that counts, Its who counted the votes !!

It is absolutely crazy to me that in democratic societies, the voting process is a secret process. WHY? this opens the door to fraud and voter rigging, a government or party could fudge the numbers and everybody would be non the wiser.
attributes.additional_details:
By making votes transparent on a Gov website, everyone can see their name and everyone can independently verify the facts... not only will this be a fairer society but it means as a people we can start to build some trust back to our government, just looked what happened with the Scottish independence vote, very close to call... but plenty cried foul play .. with a transparent system we all would know... and truth is a very rare commodity these days.
